@MrBarron91 @joshcannon93 @ESPNFC I never questioned his form this season, I literally just mentioned it would be funny to see Keane walk into the room and you waded in talking about all sorts of stuff.

@MrBarron91 @joshcannon93 @ESPNFC I’ve honestly no idea what your on about now. Keane was a far superior player who won far superior trophies. He was a much better player, regardless of who his manager was.

@MrBarron91 @joshcannon93 @ESPNFC Come back and talk to me about Lingard when he’s had a major contribution in winning a premiership title or Champions League (spoiler, he won’t). Keane on the other hand....I rest my case.

@MrBarron91 @joshcannon93 @ESPNFC Roy Keane couldn’t give a shit if he was liked by fans or not, he was there to do a job and win trophies (of which he won a fair few). Premiership is a fuckin pantomime these days, lost its soul years ago.
Carl Froch describing Dillion Whyte making wolf noises as intimidating for his opponent...na mate, he just sounds like a fanny.
@joshcannon93 @ESPNFC I fuckin hate the modern day footballer. Could you imagine Keane letting any of them get away with this patter in the dressing room? Can’t stand it
@ESPNFC @joshcannon93 I’d love to see Roy Keane walk into that room

@Browning84Greg @pieandbov Doesn’t need to come out and doesn’t need to raise his hands, but can’t be mad at the lad, he’s been in incredible form recently and saved us a fair amount of points. Bell had a very good cameo, two great saves.
@Browning84Greg @pieandbov McGinn had a bad challenge as well, no arguments there. But you had a few others that were questionable. Point was a good result all things considered.

@pieandbov Decent return for Hibs at the most important stage of the season. Never a penalty against Killy and Saints should have had a man sent off when we were leading 1-0. Could have been even better. Three very winnable home games next 🇳🇬💚
